steps.title: Access CardioServer
items: In Epic, open the patient chart → click the CardioServer SmartLink/URL.
OR on the desktop, double-click the CardioServer icon.
OR in Citrix Workspace → CardioServer → Open.
On the login page, enter AD username + password.
Confirm header shows Role = Tech User.

steps.title: Find & Filter Studies
items: Set Status filter: Preliminary / Unconfirmed / Confirmed / Stored.
Optional: set Date filter (Today, Last 7 Days, Custom).

steps.title: Link Study to Correct Patient & Order
items: Search MRN or Name → select patient.
If multiple orders show, select the correct order.
Click Save / Link → verify patient + order appear in header.

steps.title: Assign Study to Provider
items: Type provider name → select from list.
Click Save / Update → confirm provider shows in header.

steps.title: Trash & Restore Studies
items: Click More Actions → Move to Trash.
To restore (≤30 days): open Trash → select study → Restore / Untrash.

qa.q: What if a study doesn’t match any patient/order?
qa.a: Use Link/Reconcile → search MRN → select correct order.

qa.q: Can I trash a study that’s already Unconfirmed?
qa.a: No, only Preliminary studies can be trashed.

qa.q: How do I restore a deleted study?
qa.a: Go to Trash view → select study → Restore (within 30 days).

steps.title: Open Encounter
items: Open the patient’s encounter to begin.
Confirm correct patient chart is active.

steps.title: Locate Connect Section
items: Navigate to the Rooming tab or the Plan tab.

steps.title: Start Video Visit
items: From the Connect section, click Start Video Visit.
If enabled, select Send to Haiku/Kanto for mobile devices.

steps.title: Invite Participants
items: Click Send Direct Link to add participants.
For Providers: use Provider Invite option (pulls provider info from Epic).
For Guests: enter guest’s name, relationship, and email/phone → click Send.

steps.title: Verify Contact Info
items: Double-check email/phone details before sending invite.

steps.title: Device Setup & Hardware Test
items: On joining, set up microphone, webcam, and speakers.
Run hardware test (optional to skip for 18 hrs).

steps.title: Admit Participants
items: Use the menu to admit participants individually.

steps.title: Manage Participants
items: Remove participant (note: removed users cannot rejoin).

steps.title: Call Controls & Screen Sharing
items: Use controls for microphone, webcam, and screen share.
Be cautious when sharing screens with PHI.

steps.title: End Call
items: Click End Call → ends for everyone.
Best practice: End Call once session is complete.

qa.q: Where can I start an EVC visit?
qa.a: In the patient’s encounter under the Rooming or Plan tab → Connect section.

qa.q: Can I invite guests?
qa.a: Yes. Enter guest’s name, relationship, and email/phone → Send invite.

qa.q: What happens if I remove a participant?
qa.a: They cannot rejoin unless reinvited.

qa.q: Should I leave or end the call?
qa.a: Always click End Call to close the session for everyone.

steps.title: Track Board Overview
items: Review columns for Bed, Name, Age, Complaint, Acuity, Staff initials.
Hover over initials for full staff names.

steps.title: Order Status Icons
items: Check columns showing EKG, Meds, Labs, Imaging.
Counts show Placed, In Process, Completed.

steps.title: Registration & Disposition
items: X = Registration incomplete (does not block discharge).

steps.title: Layout Customization
items: Move items (e.g., Suicide Risk) to preferred position.

steps.title: Views
items: Click magnifying glass for more info.

qa.q: What does an X in registration mean?
qa.a: Registration incomplete. It won’t block discharge.

qa.q: How do I see pending labs?
qa.a: Check order columns: Placed, In Process, Completed.

steps.title: Receiving & Processing
items: Add FYIs or cancel/redraw if needed.

qa.q: How do I reprint a specimen label?
qa.a: Open the Order → select Reprint Label.

qa.q: Where do I check pending tests?
qa.a: Check the Outstanding List.

steps.title: Electronic Consent
items: If refusal: print, ink sign, scan, send to HIM.

steps.title: Intra-Op Workflow
items: Use Sidebar Quick Events: In Room, Procedure Start, etc.

qa.q: How do I substitute a signer on consent?
qa.a: Enter alternate signer name and add a nurse witness.

qa.q: What if patient refuses e-signature?
qa.a: Print the form, capture ink signature, scan, send to HIM.

qa.q: Where do I reconcile medications?
qa.a: During admission, transfer, and discharge.

qa.q: What if there’s a hard stop in an order set?
qa.a: You must address it before proceeding.

steps.title: Dashboard & In Basket
items: Check In Basket: refills, reminders, time changes.

steps.title: Dispense Functions
items: Choose Prep, Cart Fill, Compounding, Repackaging, or Barcode Validation.

steps.title: Cart Fill Troubleshooting
items: If printer is down, reroute jobs.

steps.title: Barcode Validation
items: Submit mismatches with details (name, strength, form, mfr, NDC, cost).

qa.q: What if cart fill labels don’t print?
qa.a: Manually reprint via the Dispense button.

qa.q: What if IID is blank?
qa.a: Submit a ticket for IID assignment.

steps.title: Referrals
items: If provider missing, enroll using FIND tool.

qa.q: How do I activate MyChart?
qa.a: Send activation via text/email; valid 14 days.

qa.q: How do I schedule telemedicine?
qa.a: Use Telemedicine visit type.

steps.title: Go-Live Overview
items: Saint Francis Evanston + Holy Family Medical Center.
Holy Family is first LTACH (long-term care) in Prime.

steps.title: New Features
items: Epic Narrators for code, rapid response, sepsis, trauma, etc.
Rovers not used for meds/wounds; use cameras + scanners.

steps.title: Clinical Documentation
items: Patient expiration navigator with donor forms.
Critical values documented with provider read-back.

steps.title: Specialty Workflows
items: Wound care with Four Eyes Assessment.
Charge capture for dialysis and wound care.

steps.title: Holy Family LTACH Workflows
items: Complete LTCH care data set at admit/discharge.
Transfers from Prime require discharge + readmit.
Leave of Absence workflows for infusions/visits.

steps.title: Outstanding Items
items: Updated tip sheets to be distributed.
Help desk tickets for missing referral facilities.
Include LTACH and MRI tip sheets in repository.

qa.q: What’s unique about Holy Family?
qa.a: It’s the first Prime LTACH with distinct workflows.

qa.q: Where can I find tip sheets?
qa.a: They will be emailed and stored in the shared repository.

steps.title: SDOH Documentation
items: Save to trigger BPA if applicable.

steps.title: Specimen Collection
items: Collect specimen → mark as Collected in Epic.
Toggle Lab/Unit view in Storyboard if needed.

steps.title: Patient Expiration
items: Complete death, donor, and body release documentation.
Generate forms → collect signatures → scan to HIM.

steps.title: Belongings & Meds
items: Document belongings in Navigator or flowsheet.
Reconcile home meds, mark Med List as reviewed.

steps.title: Provider Notification
items: Document critical lab values in flowsheet.

qa.q: Where do I document SDOH risks?
qa.a: In the SDOH Navigator section; BPA triggers consult order.

qa.q: How do I handle belongings?
qa.a: Use navigator/flowsheet with e-signature form for patient + staff.

qa.q: What happens with critical values?
qa.a: Flowsheet prompts for provider notification and read-back documentation.
